pull.title: doc: reintegrate 0.19.0 release notes
pull.body:
This reintegrates the WIP release notes from the [wiki](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.19.0-Release-Notes-Draft).

This also adds a note to the release notes about macOS Catalina users having to "right click" and "Open" to open the DMG. Happy to adjust this as required.

events.body:
Looks like there have been some changes since you opened this.

Please pick up the latest changes, then replace the wiki page with a message, so no more edits are done there.

I'll merge this tomorrow, before tagging -final.

events.message: doc: add macOS DMG opening note to release notes

events.body: Have pulled in the final changes and closed editing in the wiki.

ACK 8bca3ce0b121b77bec4915617dfceed4c023962c

I'm going to move forward with this, there's been plenty of time to make edits on the wiki, or comment on one of the issues related with 0.19. We don't tend to hold up releases on release notes.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,9 +43,9 @@ built using Qt 5.9.x, which doesn't support versions of macOS older than
 10.10. Additionally, Bitcoin Core does not yet change appearance when
 macOS "dark mode" is activated.
 
-In addition to previously-supported CPU platforms, this release's
-pre-compiled distribution also provides binaries for the RISC-V
-platform.
+Users running macOS Catalina may need to "right-click" and then choose "Open"
+to open the Bitcoin Core .dmg. This is due to new signing requirements
+imposed by Apple, which the Bitcoin Core project does not yet adhere too.
 
 Notable changes
comments.body:
Shouldn't we mention #16714 here?
It is a really notable change for bitcoin-qt users.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,9 +43,9 @@ built using Qt 5.9.x, which doesn't support versions of macOS older than
 10.10. Additionally, Bitcoin Core does not yet change appearance when
 macOS "dark mode" is activated.
 
-In addition to previously-supported CPU platforms, this release's
-pre-compiled distribution also provides binaries for the RISC-V
-platform.
+Users running macOS Catalina may need to "right-click" and then choose "Open"
+to open the Bitcoin Core .dmg. This is due to new signing requirements
+imposed by Apple, which the Bitcoin Core project does not yet adhere too.

comments.body: Gui users will either see the intro screen and the new feature, because it is a fresh install. Or they don't, because it is not a fresh install. In either case it wouldn't help them if they knew about it upfront. Also, at some point we need to pull the release notes and push out the release.
